docs.title: Home
docs.text:
Welcome to Opteryx Documentation

Fast, lightweight SQL analytics for your data — run queries locally or in the cloud with minimal fuss.

Get started

Quick start

Run your first query in minutes and explore Opteryx capabilities.

Architecture

Read about the execution engine, planner, and optimizer internals.

Security & permissions

How to secure access, configure roles, and manage permissions.

docs.title: Featured resources
docs.text: Dive into our top picks

docs.title: What is Opteryx?
docs.text: Opteryx is a SQL query engine designed for analyzing data across various sources with a focus on performance and ease of use.

docs.title: Key Features
docs.text:
• SQL Compatibility: Full SQL query support for data analysis
  • Multiple Data Sources: Query data from various sources seamlessly
  • High Performance: Optimized for fast query execution
  • Easy to Use: Simple setup and intuitive interface

docs.title: Quick Links
docs.text:
• Installation Guide - Get started with Opteryx
  • Quick Start Tutorial - Learn the basics in minutes
  • About Opteryx - Learn more about the project

docs.title: Getting Help
docs.text:
If you need help or have questions:

  • Visit our GitHub repository
  • Report issues on GitHub Issues

docs.title: License
docs.text: Opteryx is open source software. Please refer to the main repository for license information.

docs.title: Project Overview
docs.text: Opteryx is an open-source SQL query engine designed to provide flexible and efficient data analysis capabilities.

docs.title: Project Goals
docs.text:
The main goals of Opteryx include:

  • Flexibility: Support for querying diverse data sources
  • Performance: Fast query execution and optimization
  • Simplicity: Easy to use and integrate into existing workflows
  • Standards Compliance: SQL standard compatibility where possible

docs.title: Architecture
docs.text:
Opteryx is built with a modular architecture that allows for:

  • Extensible data source connectors
  • Pluggable optimization strategies
  • Efficient query execution

docs.title: Community
docs.text: Opteryx is developed and maintained by Mabel Dev and the open-source community.

docs.title: Contributing
docs.text:
We welcome contributions! Please visit our GitHub repository to:

  • Report bugs
  • Suggest features
  • Submit pull requests
  • Improve documentation

docs.title: License
docs.text: Please refer to the LICENSE file in the main repository for license information.

docs.title: Contact
docs.text:
• GitHub: mabel-dev/opteryx
  • Issues: GitHub Issues

docs.title: Installation
docs.text: This guide will help you install Opteryx on your system.

docs.title: Prerequisites
docs.text:
Before installing Opteryx, ensure you have:

  • Python 3.8 or higher
  • pip (Python package installer)

docs.title: Install via pip
docs.text:
The easiest way to install Opteryx is using pip:

pip install opteryx

docs.title: Install from Source
docs.text:
To install the latest development version from source:

git clone https://github.com/mabel-dev/opteryx.git
cd opteryx
pip install -e .

docs.title: Verify Installation
docs.text:
After installation, verify that Opteryx is installed correctly:

import opteryx
print(opteryx.__version__)

docs.title: Next Steps
docs.text: Once you have Opteryx installed, proceed to the Quick Start Guide to learn how to use it.

docs.title: Quick Start
docs.text: This guide will help you get started with Opteryx quickly.

docs.title: Your First Query
docs.text:
Here's a simple example to get you started with Opteryx:

import opteryx

# Execute a simple query
result = opteryx.query("SELECT 'Hello, Opteryx!' AS greeting")

# Display the results
for row in result:
    print(row)

docs.title: Querying In-Memory Data
docs.text:
You can query data from Python data structures:

import opteryx

# Create sample data
data = [
    {"name": "Alice", "age": 30},
    {"name": "Bob", "age": 25},
    {"name": "Charlie", "age": 35}
]

# Query the data
result = opteryx.query("""
    SELECT name, age 
    FROM $data 
    WHERE age > 25
""", variables={"data": data})

# Print results
for row in result:
    print(f"{row['name']} is {row['age']} years old")

docs.title: SELECT Queries
docs.text:
import opteryx

# Simple SELECT
result = opteryx.query("SELECT 1 AS number, 'test' AS text")

docs.title: Filtering Data
docs.text:
import opteryx

# Using WHERE clause
result = opteryx.query("""
    SELECT * 
    FROM my_data 
    WHERE column_name = 'value'
""")

  • Explore more complex SQL queries
  • Learn about connecting to different data sources
  • Check out advanced features and optimizations

docs.title: GROUP BY
docs.text:
-- Sed do eiusmod GROUP BY
SELECT 
    category,
    COUNT(*) as total_count,
    SUM(amount) as total_amount,
    AVG(amount) as average_amount
FROM transactions
GROUP BY category;

docs.title: Common Table Expressions (CTEs)
docs.text:
-- Sed do eiusmod CTE
WITH monthly_sales AS (
    SELECT 
        DATE_TRUNC('month', order_date) as month,
        SUM(amount) as total
    FROM orders
    GROUP BY 1
)
SELECT * FROM monthly_sales
WHERE total > 10000;
